caption.p: Percentage inhibition by plant extracts against Fusarium semitectum (1 × 10 6 spores/mL) inoculated on maize seeds. Plant compounds were extracted in EA: Ethyl acetate. The extracts were produced from Lantana camara, Combretum molle and used at a concentration of 2.5 mg dried extract/mL of 10% acetone. Amphotericin B antibiotic (2.5 mg/mL) was used as a positive control. There were 3 replicates per treatment, each comprising 7.5 g of disinfected maize seeds, and the experiment was repeated twice. Data from the two repeat experiments were averaged and analysed statistically. Bars bearing different letters indicate significant differences ( p = 0.05), as determined by Duncan’s Multiple Range Test.
